page.title: 04BUILDIND SUPPLIER PATRINGTON
page.content: In 1979 the old Brickworks were puchased with 5 acres of land. It was re-built from a near derelict state between 1980 and 1985 and named Fasco (Buildings) Ltd., now consisting of an office block, woodwork shop, hardware and timber storage and vehicle repair shop. Steel frame buildings are made, 70% of which are for farming communities in Lincolnshire and Yorkshire. At present 25 people are employed using 2 mobile cranes, 2 tipping lorries, 1 flat lorry, 5 vans, 2 excavators, 3 fork lift trucks, the whole production being based on side loaders.{In 1983 Fasco won the {Business and Industry Award Major {Commendation in recognition of human {and social responsibility and {environmental quality. In 1984 they {won the Times Conservation Award.}
